column1: Dwaling was a village in the far Northern parts of the Eastfarthing of the Shire
column2: just north of the hills of Scary.
Tolkien said that Dwaling was a regular toponymic formation of a settlements name
column3: "the descendants of Dwale". Dwale would be a nick-name of one particular Hobbit
column4: and the name was derived from Old English dwale
column6: Undated note part of Guide to the Names in The Lord of the Rings
